question.text:
Given below are two statements:

Statement I: Decomposition is a process in which the detritus is degraded into simpler substances by microbes.

Statement II: Decomposition is faster if the detritus is rich in lignin and chitin.

In light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:

options.text: Both Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> and Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> are incorrect

Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> is correct but Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> is incorrect

Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> is incorrect but Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> is correct
Both Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> and Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> are correct

solution.text:
The decomposers break down complex organic matter into inorganic substances like carbon dioxide, water and nutrients and the process is called decomposition.
Dead plant remains such as leaves, bark, flowers and dead remains of animals, including animal faecal matter, constitute detritus, which is the raw material for decomposition.

During decomposition, the detritus is digested by the enzymes released by microbes, like bacteria, fungus, etc. Decomposition is faster in humid condition and on cellulosic material.
